name: British PM Tony Blair Online Trivia | British Prime Ministers | 10 Questions

questions.text: Of which party was Tony Blair the leader?
questions.explanation:
Labour.

	Tony Blair was leader of the Labour Party from 1997 to 2007. The party adopted the name "New Labour" after his elevation to the leadership in 1994.

questions.text: Where did Tony Blair go to University?
questions.explanation:
Oxford.

	He studied at St John's College, Oxford. He went to school in Edinburgh.

questions.text: What was Blair's profession before he went into politics?
questions.explanation:
Barrister.

	He was a barrister, in the chambers of future Lord Chancellor, Derry Irvine.

questions.text: What is Tony Blair's wife's first name?
questions.explanation:
Cherie.

	Cherie Booth is a successful barrister.

questions.text: How many children do the Blairs have?
questions.explanation:
4.

	They had three children - Euan, Nicky and Kathryn - when Blair became PM, and the fourth child, Leo, was born this year.

questions.text: What constituency did Tony Blair represent?
questions.explanation:
Sedgefield.

	He represented Sedgefield in County Durham, from 1983 to 2007.

questions.text: Where was Tony Blair's London home before he became Prime Minister in 1997?
questions.explanation:
Islington.

	He was said to epitomize 'Islington man', young progressive professionals.

questions.text: Tony Blair had never served in government before becoming Prime Minister.
questions.explanation:
True.

	His party had been in opposition since May 1979, when Margaret Thatcher became prime minister.

questions.text: Politics was not Tony Blair's main enthusiasm at University. What was?
questions.explanation:
Rock music.

	He played guitar with a band named Ugly Rumours, whilst studying at Oxford.

questions.text: Before getting elected, Tony Blair stood unsuccessfully in a parliamentary by-election for which seat?
questions.explanation:
Beaconsfield.

	Beaconsfield in Buckinghamshire is one of the safest Conservative seats in the country, and was held with a 61.8% vote. Tony Blair collected 10.4% of the vote. The by-election was held in February 1982.
